description.narrative: The CHS Alliance improves the effectiveness and impact of assistance to people and communities vulnerable to risk and affected by disaster, conflict or poverty, by working with humanitarian and development actors on quality, accountability and people management initiatives. The Core Humanitarian Standard on Quality and Accountability (CHS), which sets out Nine Commitments that the humanitarian sector can use to improve the quality and effectiveness of their assistance, is at the heart of CHS Alliance’s mission. This investment supports CHS Alliance to lead and facilitate development, promotion and maintenance of the CHS, including by providing training and capacity building to its 240+ members and the wider sector. The total estimated value of this investment is $0.9 million to be expensed over 3 years, starting during the 2018-19 financial year.
